New issue

Thread bug with Rails::Engine mounted routes, undefined method `url_options' #19084

Open
sbull opened this Issue Feb 26, 2015 · 19 comments

Labels

actionpack engines With reproduction steps

Milestone

No milestone

Assignee

No one assigned

7 participants

sbull commented Feb 26, 2015

This issue occurs randomly in production, as it's a multi-threading problem. This is very related to puma/puma#647, and the underlying MRI bug https://bugs.ruby-lang.org/issues/10871.

I'm using a mounted engine, rails_admin, and I get the following exception frequently in one of my views, in which I have rails_admin.show_path(model_name: 'dummy', id: 123).

ActionView::Template::Error: undefined method `url_options' for #<Module:0x007f432e67dc20>
action_dispatch/routing/route_set.rb:271:in `call'
    controller_options = t.url_options
  action_dispatch/routing/route_set.rb:222:in `call'
    super
  action_dispatch/routing/route_set.rb:334:in `block (2 levels) in define_url_helper'
    helper.call self, args, options
  action_dispatch/routing/mapper.rb:637:in `block (2 levels) in define_generate_prefix'
    _routes.url_helpers.send("#{name}_path", prefix_options)
  action_dispatch/routing/route_set.rb:775:in `url_for'
    script_name = find_script_name options
  action_dispatch/routing/route_set.rb:279:in `call'
    t._routes.url_for(hash, route_name, url_strategy)
  action_dispatch/routing/route_set.rb:222:in `call'
    super
  action_dispatch/routing/route_set.rb:334:in `block (2 levels) in define_url_helper'
    helper.call self, args, options
...

I have isolated the problem with a reproducible test script and example output here:
https://gist.github.com/sbull/78eb41fdfd0460f5ce80#file-route_helpers_debug-rb

I am able to work around thread problems with the use of Rails.application.routes.url_helpers in other contexts in my app, but I haven't yet found a way to workaround this problem with routes for mounted engines. Hopefully there's a way for these mounted url helpers to work around the underlying bug in MRI.

/cc @evanphx, /cc @tenderlove (due to involvement in previous issue)

evanphx commented Feb 26, 2015

This should be fixed by #19007 by not invoking url_helpers concurrently.

sbull commented Feb 26, 2015

Would any workarounds be apparent in the meantime?

sbull commented Feb 26, 2015

I'm attempting to create a workaround for this using a Mutex. I've been able to greatly reduce the frequency of errors, but not eliminate it completely. Here's the details: https://gist.github.com/sbull/e83defaa7c6a93950866

I'm including the important bits here:

class TestEngine < Rails::Engine; end
TestEngine.routes.draw do
  get '/' => 'dummy#index', as: :dummy
end

Rails.application.routes.draw do
  mount TestEngine, at: '-', as: 'test_routes'
end

class TestController < ActionController::Base
  def engine_test
    render plain: RouteHelper.one.dummy_path
  end
end

ROUTES_MUTEX = Mutex.new

class RouteHelper

  class UrlHelpers
    include TestEngine.routes.url_helpers
  end

  def self.one
    @@one
  end

  def self.one=(one)
    @@one = one
  end

  def self.url_helpers=(url_helpers)
    @@url_helpers = url_helpers
  end

  def method_missing(symbol, *args)
    ROUTES_MUTEX.synchronize {
      @@url_helpers.send(symbol, *args)
    }
  end

end

RouteHelper.one = RouteHelper.new
RouteHelper.url_helpers = RouteHelper::UrlHelpers.new

puts "Running Mounted Engine dummy_path..."
run_threads do
  env = { 'REQUEST_METHOD' => 'GET', 'rack.input' => StringIO.new }
  status, headers, rack_body = TestController.action('engine_test').call(env)
  rack_body.body
end

Now, as best as I can reason, the ROUTES_MUTEX would prevent any concurrent invoking of the buggy url_helpers. I've tried a few other variations of this, and I still get an error every few times I run the test script.

This makes me concerned that there's something causing problems that I don't understand. As far as I can see, the real url_helpers would never be called concurrently. @evanphx, is there any chance that you can take a peek to let me know where this workaround is failing?

evanphx commented Feb 26, 2015

@sbull you could probably take the change I did in #19007 and make it a hot patch you put into your initializers, to just fix the core rails behavior.

jvanbaarsen commented Feb 26, 2015

@rafaelfranca can you add the label "With reproduction steps"?

sbull commented Feb 26, 2015

@evanphx I've tried adding a monkeypatch with your fix in #19007 to my original reproduction script. It has the result of reducing the frequency of the problem, but not fixing it. (Originally I was getting an average of 8 failed threads out of 10, with the monkeypatch I get an average of 5 failed threads out of 10.) Here's the reproduction with the monkeypatch: https://gist.github.com/sbull/5d716e74bcc323b29895

When I tried my workaround approach above with a Mutex, I would get either no failures or 1 failure, regardless of how many threads or iterations per thread I tried.

sbull commented Feb 27, 2015

If anyone is interested in an "almost fixed" workaround, here's what I've done:

module Routes
  class RailsAdmin
    class UrlHelpers
      include ::RailsAdmin::Engine.routes.url_helpers
    end
    @@semaphore = Mutex.new
    @@url_helpers = UrlHelpers.new
    def method_missing(symbol, *args)
      @@semaphore.synchronize {
        @@url_helpers.send(symbol, *args)
      }
    end
    def self.solo
      @@solo
    end
    @@solo = self.new
  end
  def self.rails_admin
    RailsAdmin.solo
  end
end

And I use it like Routes.rails_admin.show_path(model_name: 'post', id: 123). So far, this works in real life, but produces an occasional error in my contrived reproduction script. (See puma/puma#647 for a workaround for generating non-engine urls outside of requests.)

rafaelfranca added needs feedback and removed With reproduction steps labels Apr 8, 2015
sbull commented Apr 9, 2015

Short answer: problem still exists on master.

I've tried this again using a clone of rails master (git clone git://github.com/rails/rails.git, cd rails, bundle install, bundle exec rails new ../rails-routes-bug --dev), and run my test script again (bundle exec rails runner route_helpers_debug.rb). It appears that the frequency of the issue is greatly reduced, but it still happens occasionally. In fact, I've had to increase the number of threads/iterations to exhibit the problem.

Here's the updated gist with the script and the output: https://gist.github.com/sbull/114f93a374136ace74f1

sbull commented Aug 10, 2015

I've just followed the same steps as above (#19084 (comment)), and run my test script with increased values like bundle exec rails runner route_helpers_debug.rb 20 30 to make the same errors happen (Exception in thread 17, iteration 28: undefined method `url_options' for #<Module:0x007f7e34e8c808>).

evanphx commented Aug 10, 2015

The bug is actually in ruby itself. I believe it was fixed in a 2.2 release. /cc @_ko1 @tenderlove

ahacop commented Aug 10, 2015

I can confirm that I followed the reproduction steps with the increased values suggested by @sbull and did not get any errors while using 2.2.2.

sbull commented Aug 10, 2015

Yeah, I just ran this using 2.2.2 and it still has the bug. Per https://bugs.ruby-lang.org/issues/10871#note-12, I don't think it's merged yet.

@ahacop, can you increase those values and try running several times? Basically, keep increasing them, and eventually you'll run into the problem (it's non-deterministic, probably depends on cpu resources etc.)

ahacop commented Aug 10, 2015

@sbull I did eventually run into the error. But, if this is a bug in ruby, can this issue be closed?

sbull commented Aug 10, 2015

Well, it's a bug in ruby, but that bug is only exhibited by certain styles of code. So if this Rails feature were implemented differently, it may not have the bug.

evanphx commented Aug 10, 2015

@ahacop It's up to the rails contributors, but I'd leave it open because people running rails hit it and wonder where it's coming from.

dlackty commented Dec 17, 2015

https://www.ruby-lang.org/en/news/2015/12/16/ruby-2-2-4-released/
